Reviewing the Server Logs

The server logs record the activity on a particular server configuration. Each time you start a server configuration, the Server creates new files for the current session and renames the existing log files with names that reflect the date and time at which they were renamed.

If the server has a locale other than US English, two server logs are generated. The format for the new log names is Server.locale.log. The first server log is named Server.en-US.log and is always generated (if only for support purposes). The name of the second log depends on the locale where the server has been installed. For example, its name might be Server.fr-FR.log if it is installed in France.

Log files are stored in the Repository folder for the server configuration. You can view their contents at any time, even while the server configuration is running. You can find the location of the files from the Server Administration dialog.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To view the server log:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

  4. Click the Server Log shortcut in the lower left panel. If it is not displayed, click the Accounts bar and it will display.

  5. From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Server Log.

    6. The Server Log dialog opens.

  6. Review the Server Log text box to see the contents of the server log files.

  7. To see the most recent entries, click Reload.
